alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 10 at 10:45AM EST until March 19 at 8:12AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... White River from Centerton to Hazelton. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Indiana... White River near Nora. White River at Ravenswood. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... White River at Edwardsport. White River at Spencer. White River at Newberry. White River below Eagle Valley Power Plant. White River near Centerton. .Ongoing flooding will continue along portions of the East Fork White, White, and Wabash Rivers and their tributaries. River stages are rising again due to previous rainfall over the weekend. Minor flooding is largely expected, which primarily impacts river roads, parks, and agricultural land. The crest on the Wabash River is between Lafayette and Covington. The crest on the White River is near Spencer. The crest on the East Fork White River is between Seymour and Rivervale. New precipitation amounts through the weekend will not impact current flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY, MARCH 19... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...Until Saturday, March 19. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Extensive flooding is progress affecting agricultural and rural residential areas. Several rural county roads extensively flooded including Bottoms Rd...Brothers Rd and E. Governor Rd in Knox County. A few residents may move out in an area locally known as Dodge City. Several small oil fields are inaccessible. During agricultural season much flood damage can occur. High water isolates some river cabin residents. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EST Thursday /8:30 AM CST Thursday/ the stage was 20.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM EST Thursday /8:30 AM CST Thursday/ was 20.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.7 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Friday, March 18. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
